Posts.Content: yananma wrote: I will start chemo sometime in the week of 12/10/12.  Not figured out what to do yet.  I am TN, stage 1, high grade DC, and zero lymph node.  2 treatment plans are suggested to me by 3 oncologists - TC 4 treatments, 1 every 3 weeks, or AC 4 treatment, 1 every 2 weeks, followed by T 4 treatment, 1 every 2 weeks.  Not sure which plan to go!  So torn by the decision.  One oncologist said AC-T offers 9% better 10 year survival and TC offers 7%.  So if it is true, does it worth the risk and side effects of A to get the absolute 2% benefits????? Dx 10/8/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 11/7/2012 Mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: TN, High Grade, Invasive DC tumor 1.2cm, Stage 1 at Age 40 yananma SaracVA

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2012 01:38PM yananma wrote: Mfml, my mo did offer two types of taxol, 12 weekly or 4 treatment biweekly. I rule 12 weekly out rightaway. I pushed my mo to give me stats. I am a CPA, so I demand numbers- unless there is a huge benefits, I am not convinced! 1 or 2% can totally be a rounding, per accountant's book...
Posts.Title: TN, High Grade, Invasive DC tumor 1.2cm, Stage 1 at Age 40 yananma SaracVA

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2012 01:45PM yananma wrote: Thank you all for weighing in. The oncologist recommending ac-t said it gives me additional 9% survival rate, while TC gives 7%. So 2% additional benefits for ac-t. Anyone heard of the stat? A is aggressive drug. Does it and 4 additional treatment worth 2% absolute benefits?

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2013 09:01PM yananma wrote: Day 3 after chemo #3. Had a big fight with hubby over the kids ( age 8 and 5). Now he took the kids out somewhere and I am in bed alone in the house , gloomy day, so sad, and aching and nausea too. I am trying to do the best as I can, working full time, paying the bills, making sure the kids on their homework ... And chemo treatments.... Lets not forget that.... Why does life have to be so hard.... I am strong, but why me?!
